test-set.name: prod-FunctionCall
test-set.description: Tests for the FunctionCall production. Contains tests verifying the function calling mechanism; not a particular function implementation.

schema.description: A schema defining a list of unions.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-001
test-case.description: Test that arguments are atomized - built in function

test-case.name: FunctionCall-002
test-case.description: Test that arguments are atomized - constructor function

test-case.name: FunctionCall-003
test-case.description: Test that arguments are atomized - constructor function

test-case.name: FunctionCall-004
test-case.description: Test that arguments are atomized - user-defined function
test-case.test: declare function local:f($in as xs:boolean) as xs:boolean { $in }; local:f(0)

test-case.name: FunctionCall-005
test-case.description: Test that arguments are atomized - user-defined function
test-case.test: declare function local:f($in as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:boolean { $in instance of xs:decimal }; local:f(validate type xs:integer {12})

test-case.name: FunctionCall-006
test-case.description: Test that arguments are atomized - anonymous inline function
test-case.test: let $f := function ($in as xs:boolean) as xs:boolean { $in } return $f(0)

test-case.name: FunctionCall-007
test-case.description: Test that arguments are atomized - dynamic call to a user-defined function

test-case.name: FunctionCall-008
test-case.description: Test that arguments are atomized - dynamic call to a constructor function

test-case.name: FunctionCall-009
test-case.description: Test that a sequence of untypedAtomic values is cast to the target type: user-defined function. Also tests XPath 3.0 casting to list, and bang operator.
test-case.test: declare function local:f($in as xs:decimal*) as xs:decimal {sum($in, 0.0)}; local:f(xs:NMTOKENS('1 1.2 1.3 1.4')!xs:untypedAtomic(.))

test-case.name: FunctionCall-010
test-case.description: Test that a sequence of untypedAtomic values is cast to the target type: inline function. Also tests XPath 3.0 inline functions, casting to list, and bang operator.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-011
test-case.description: Test that a sequence of untypedAtomic values is cast to the target type: built-in function. Also tests casting to list, and bang operator.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-012
test-case.description: Test that a sequence of NON-untypedAtomic values is NOT cast to the target type: built-in function. Also tests casting to list.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-013
test-case.description: Test that the untypedAtomic result of a user-defined function is cast to the declared type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-014
test-case.description: Test that the untypedAtomic result of an inline function is cast to the declared type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-015
test-case.description: Test that arguments are atomized - but not the argument of casting to QName

test-case.name: FunctionCall-016
test-case.description: Test that untyped arguments are converted - but not when the expected type is QName

test-case.name: FunctionCall-017
test-case.description: Test that untyped arguments are converted - but not when the expected type is QName

test-case.name: FunctionCall-018
test-case.description: Test that untyped arguments are converted - but not when the expected type is QName

test-case.name: FunctionCall-019
test-case.description: Test that untyped results are converted - but not when the expected type is QName

test-case.name: FunctionCall-020
test-case.description: Test that untyped results are converted - but not when the expected type is QName

test-case.name: FunctionCall-021
test-case.description: Test that untyped results are converted - but not when the expected type is QName

test-case.name: FunctionCall-023
test-case.description: Test that a sequence of arguments is atomized

test-case.name: FunctionCall-025
test-case.description: Test that a sequence of numeric values undergoes numeric promotion to the target type. Also tests XPath 3.0 inline functions.
test-case.test: function($in as xs:double*) as xs:double {sum($in, 0.0e0)}((1, xs:float(0.25), xs:decimal(0.5)))

test-case.name: FunctionCall-026
test-case.description: Test that a sequence of anyURI values undergoes numeric promotion to the target type. Also tests XPath 3.0 inline functions.
test-case.test: function($in as xs:string*) as xs:string {string-join($in, ';')}((xs:anyURI('http://one.com/'), xs:anyURI('http://two.com/')))

test-case.name: FunctionCall-027
test-case.description: Test that an untypedAtomic value is NOT cast to the target type where the target type is a list type. This is an error because although casting to a list type is allowed, a list type cannot be used in a function signature.
test-case.test: function($in as xs:NMTOKENS) as item()* {$in}(xs:untypedAtomic('abc def'))

test-case.name: FunctionCall-028
test-case.description: Test that the target type can be a union type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-029
test-case.description: Test that the target type can be a union type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-030
test-case.description: Test that numeric promotion does not occur when the target type is a union type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-031
test-case.description: Test that casting of untypedAtomic does occur when the target type is a union type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-032
test-case.description: Test that the argument type cannot be a union type having a list type in its membership.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-033
test-case.description: Test that the argument type cannot be a union type derived by restriction from another union type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-034
test-case.description: Test that the argument type cannot be a list type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-035
test-case.description: Test that the result type can be a union type and that the return value can be a member of the union.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-036
test-case.description: Test that the result type can be a union type and that the return value can be a member of the union.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-037
test-case.description: Test that the result type can be a union type and that the return value can be cast to the union type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-038
test-case.description: Test that the result type can be a union type and that the return value can be cast to the union type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-039
test-case.description: Test that the result type cannot be a union type derived by restriction from another union.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-040
test-case.description: Test that the result type can be a namespace-sensitive union type.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-041
test-case.description: Test that if the result type is a namespace-sensitive union type, casting from untypedAtomic is not allowed.

test-case.name: FunctionCall-042
test-case.description: Test that Union(A, B) is substitutable for A as a function argument type

test-case.name: FunctionCall-043
test-case.description: Test that Union(Union(A, B), c) is substitutable for Union(A, B) as a function argument type

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `func-does-not-exist(1, 2, 3)`.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `fn:func-does-not-exist(1, 2, 3)`.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `xs:func-does-not-exist(1, 2, 3)`.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `local:func-does-not-exist(1, 2, 3)`.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-5
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `prefix-does-not-exist:func-does-not-exist(1, 2, 3)`.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-6
test-case.description: A function call containing an invalid QName as name.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-7
test-case.description: A function call containing an invalid QName as name.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-8
test-case.description: A function call containing an invalid QName as name.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-9
test-case.description: A function call containing an invalid QName as name.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-10
test-case.description: A function call containing an invalid QName as name.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-11
test-case.description: No function by name fn:document() exists(although one does in XSL-T).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-12
test-case.description: No function by name fn:unparsed-text() exists(although one does in XSL-T).

modified.change: Added dependency on XP20/XQ10. Removed possible result 'XTDE1170'

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-13
test-case.description: No function by name fn:unparsed-text() exists(although one does in XSL-T).

modified.change: Added dependency on XP20/XQ10. Removed possible result 'false'

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-14
test-case.description: No function by name fn:key() exists(although one does in XSL-T).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-15
test-case.description: No function by name fn:format-number() exists in XQuery 1.0 (although one does in XSLT and in XQuery 3.0).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-15a
test-case.description: No function by name fn:format-number() exists in XQuery 1.0 (although one does in XSLT and in XQuery 3.0).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-16
test-case.description: No function by name fn:format-time() exists in XQuery 1.0 (although one does in XSLT).

modified.change: split into XQ10 and XQ30 tests

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-16a
test-case.description: No function by name fn:format-time() exists in XQuery 1.0 (although one does in XSLT).

modified.change: split into XQ10 and XQ30 tests

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-17
test-case.description: No function by name fn:format-time() exists in XQuery 1.0 (although one does in XSLT).

modified.change: split into XQ10 and XQ30 tests

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-17a
test-case.description: No function by name fn:format-time() exists in XQuery 1.0 (although one does in XSLT).

modified.change: split into XQ10 and XQ30 tests

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-18
test-case.description: No function by name fn:format-date() exists in XQuery 1.0 (although one does in XSLT and XQuery 1.1).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-19
test-case.description: No function by name fn:format-dateTime() exists in XQuery 1.0 (although one does in XSLT and XQuery 1.1).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-20
test-case.description: No function by name fn:format-dateTime() exists in XQuery 1.0 (although one does in XSLT and XQuery 1.1).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-21
test-case.description: No function by name fn:format-dateTime() exists in XQuery 1.0 (although it does exist in XSLT and XQuery 1.1).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-22
test-case.description: No function by name fn:current() exists(although one does in XSLT).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-23
test-case.description: No function by name fn:unparsed-entity-uri() exists(although one does in XSLT).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-24
test-case.description: No function by name fn:unparsed-entity-public-id() exists(although one does in XSL-T).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-25
test-case.description: No function by name fn:generate-id() exists(although one does in XSLT).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-25a
test-case.description: Function by name fn:generate-id() does exist in XQuery 3.0.

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-26
test-case.description: No function by name fn:system-property() exists(although one does in XSL-T).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-27
test-case.description: No function by name fn:escape-uri() exists(although one did in older 'Functions & Operators' drafts).

test-case.name: K-FunctionCallExpr-28
test-case.description: No function by name fn:sub-sequence() exists(although one by name fn:subsequence does).

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-1
test-case.description: Two user functions with many arguments.

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-2
test-case.description: Function current-grouping-key() is not available in XQuery.

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-3
test-case.description: Function current() is not available in XQuery.

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-4
test-case.description: Function unparsed-entity-uri() is not available in XQuery.

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-5
test-case.description: Function unparsed-entity-public-id() is not available in XQuery.

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-6
test-case.description: Function generate-id() is not available in XQuery.

modified.change: Bug fix related to bug #14854: Added dependency

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-7
test-case.description: Function generate-id() is not available in XQuery(#2).

modified.change: Bug fix related to bug #14854: Added dependency

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-8
test-case.description: Function system-property() is not available in XQuery(#2).

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-9
test-case.description: Function key() is not available in XQuery.

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-10
test-case.description: Check that nodes, when passed through function arguments, have proper node identities.

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-11
test-case.description: A very simple string-difference function.
test-case.test: declare function local:compare($arg1 as xs:string, $arg2 as xs:string) { let $cps1 := string-to-codepoints($arg1), $cps2 := string-to-codepoints($arg2) return abs(count($cps1) - count($cps2)) + sum(for $x in 1 to min((count($cps1), count($cps2))) return if ($cps1[$x] ne $cps2[$x]) then 1 else ()) }; local:compare("", ""), local:compare("a", ""), local:compare("", "a"), local:compare("a", "a"), local:compare("", "aa"), local:compare("aa", "ab"), local:compare("ba", "ba"), local:compare("bab", "bbb"), local:compare("aba", "bab")

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-12
test-case.description: Trigger an infinite recursion in one implementation.

test-case.name: K2-FunctionCallExpr-13
test-case.description: Have a function which recurses infintely, but which never is called.

test-case.name: cbcl-promotion-001
test-case.description: Ensure sequence types are promoted correctly

test-case.name: cbcl-promotion-002
test-case.description: Test that type promotion occurs correctly for values passed to user-defined functions

test-case.name: cbcl-promotion-003
test-case.description: Test that type promotion occurs correctly for values returned from user-defined functions

test-case.name: cbcl-promotion-004
test-case.description: Test that type promotion occurs correctly for sequence values returned from user-defined functions

test-case.name: cbcl-promotion-005
test-case.description: Test a function declared to return optional returning more than one value
test-case.test: declare function local:index-of($seq, $item) as xs:double? { for $x at $p in $seq return if ($x eq $item) then $p else () }; local:index-of((1, 2.0, xs:float(3), 2), 2)

test-case.name: cbcl-promotion-006
test-case.description: Test a function taking optional argument being passed more than one
test-case.test: declare function local:f($arg as xs:anyAtomicType?) { $arg }; local:f(index-of((1,2,3,2),2))

test-case.name: cbcl-promotion-007
test-case.description: Check that correct type constraint is inserted.

test-case.name: function-call-reserved-function-names-001
test-case.description: Check that reserved function name attribute is handled correctly.

test-case.description: Check that reserved function name comment is handled correctly.
